body.p: Examine each of the variables in the dataset as well as their descriptions above. Identify each variable as either quantitative or categorical:

response.name: quantitative
response.feedback: Incorrect. Hospt is a categorical variable.

part.hint: Variables that take category or label values, and place an individual into one of several groups, are categorical. Variables that take numerical values and represent some kind of measurement are quantitative.

response.name: quantitative
response.feedback: Incorrect. Treat is a categorical variable.

part.hint: Variables that take category or label values, and place an individual into one of several groups, are categorical. Variables that take numerical values and represent some kind of measurement are quantitative.

response.name: quantitative
response.feedback: Incorrect. Outcome is a categorical variable.

part.hint: Variables that take category or label values, and place an individual into one of several groups, are categorical. Variables that take numerical values and represent some kind of measurement are quantitative.

response.name: categorical
response.feedback: Incorrect. Time is a quantitative variable.

part.hint: Variables that take category or label values, and place an individual into one of several groups, are categorical. Variables that take numerical values and represent some kind of measurement are quantitative.

response.name: categorical
response.feedback: Incorrect. AcuteT is a quantitative variable.

part.hint: Variables that take category or label values, and place an individual into one of several groups, are categorical. Variables that take numerical values and represent some kind of measurement are quantitative.

response.name: categorical
response.feedback: Incorrect. Age is a quantitative variable.

part.hint: Variables that take category or label values, and place an individual into one of several groups, are categorical. Variables that take numerical values and represent some kind of measurement are quantitative.

response.name: quantitative
response.feedback: Incorrect. Gender is a categorical variable.

part.hint: Variables that take category or label values, and place an individual into one of several groups, are categorical. Variables that take numerical values and represent some kind of measurement are quantitative.
